title: Price Proposal for Multiple Contracts Request
description: Get latest prices for a specific contract with different barriers.

subscribe.description: [Optional] 1 - to initiate a realtime stream of prices. Note that tick trades (without a user-defined barrier), digit trades and less than 24 hours at-the-money contracts for the following underlying symbols are not streamed: R_10, R_25, R_50, R_75, R_100, RDBULL, RDBEAR (this is because their price is constant).

amount.description: Proposed contract payout or stake value.

currency.description: This can only be the account-holder's currency.

date_start.description: [Optional] Indicates epoch value of the starting time of the contract. If left empty, the start time of the contract is now.

date_expiry.description: Epoch value of the expiry time of the contract. You must either specify date_expiry or duration.

duration_unit.description: [Optional] Duration unit - s(seconds), m(minutes), h(hours), d(days), t(ticks).

barriers.description: Array of barrier(s) for the contract.

items.description: barrier(s) for the contracts to price.

barrier.description: Barrier for the contract (or last digit prediction for digit contracts). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers. .

barrier2.description: Low barrier for the contract (for contracts with two barriers). Contracts less than 24 hours in duration would need a relative barrier (barriers which need +/-), where entry spot would be adjusted accordingly with that amount to define a barrier, except for Volatility Indices as they support both relative and absolute barriers.

trading_period_start.description: Required only for multi-barrier trading. Defines the epoch value of the trading period start time.

product_type.description: [Optional] If you specify this field, only contracts tradable through that contract type will be returned.

passthrough.description: [Optional] Used to pass data through the websocket, which may be retrieved via the echo_req output field.

req_id.description: [Optional] Used to map request to response.
